newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian shares extend losses in higher trade.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian shares extend losses in higher trade.

text.p: Lithuanian shares extended their recent losses in higher trade on Thursday and dealers continued to look down the road for gains.
"The market will go up but I think it will be after one or two weeks," said Aurelijus Rimkus, a broker at Mifonda.
"I don't think the market will pick up until the end of the summer or autumn," said Petras Slekys, a broker at Alterna Invest.
The market has been struggling since a bull run last January which analysts say was fuelled more by speculation than the real value of the infant bourse's shares.
One of the morning's top performers, Klaipeda Stevedoring Company (KLASCO), did not follow through on its earlier promise.
While KLASCO shares jumped almost 10 percent in the morning, following a similar loss the day before, turnover in the company's shares was only 33,437.30 litas.
"The supply was very low," said Grazina Baciuliene, a broker at Vilfima. "Demand was three times higher than supply."
She added that shareholders may be holding off selling KLASCO shares in the hope of driving up prices.
Among blue chips, Rokishkis Cheese dropped to 43.50 litas from 44.50 litas. Dealers said that the share appeared to be underpriced and said it had lots of room to rise.
